meanings.definition: One who portrays something, especially in a performance or work of art.
meanings.sent1: The talented portrayer captured the essence of the character in the play.
meanings.sent2: The artist was a skilled portrayer of emotions through his paintings.
meanings.sent3: The funny portrayer in the school play had everyone laughing with his exaggerated expressions.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a portrayer of her innermost thoughts, revealing everything without a word.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph served as a vivid portrayer of a bygone era.

meanings.definition: To depict or represent in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She tried to portrayer her feelings through dance when words failed her.
meanings.sent2: The director wanted to portrayer the historical event with accuracy in the film.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally portrayer the teacher as a superhero in his doodle.
meanings.sent4: The sunset portrayer a scene of tranquility and beauty across the horizon.
meanings.sent5: Her song lyrics portrayer the struggles of everyday life in a touching manner.
